questionListItems.title: Can my child/ward choose not to join a CCA?

answer.body: The Singapore education system emphasises holistic education, and this is also what the school believes in strongly. It is therefore compulsory for all secondary school students to join a CCA. By not joining a CCA, a student loses out on many valuable opportunities to interact and network with his/her peers as well as to learn and experience life skills and knowledge beyond the classroom. In practical terms, there will also be an adverse effect on your child‚Äôs/ward‚Äôs eligibility for awards, bursaries, financial aid and other forms of school-related applications.

Students are allowed to change CCAs at the end of the academic year, subject to school‚Äôs approval. However, a change of CCA is not encouraged as continuous involvement in the same CCA is needed for the progressive development of knowledge and skills, as well as the development of character traits and the formation of deep and lasting friendships with peers.

questionListItems.title: Can my child/ward join more than one CCA?

answer.body: Students may opt to join more than one CCA to broaden their school experiences, subject to the school‚Äôs approval. The level of attainment for participation will be based on his/her core CCA and not on the additional CCAs.

questionListItems.title: What is the Personal Learning Device (PLD) that students in OPSS are using?

answer.body: The Chromebook is the PLD used in OPSS. It is versatile, economical and sufficient to meet the needs for all subjects offered in OPSS.

questionListItems.title: Is it compulsory to purchase a Personal Learning Device (PLD)?

answer.body: Yes, under the MOE PDLP, all secondary school students must have a PLD for their learning.

questionListItems.title: My child/ward already owns a laptop/iPad. Can my child/ward use this as the PLD?

answer.body: Any personal device to be used as a PLD will have to be assessed by the school. If the devices meet the minimum requirements, a Device Management Application (DMA) must be installed in order for your child/ward to use these devices in school. As such, it is highly recommended to purchase a PLD via the school as we advocate for students to keep schoolwork on the PLD and usage of their personal devices separate.

DMA is an application that is installed on all PLDs. The DMA allows your child‚Äôs/ward‚Äôs activities to be monitored. This will allow you to safeguard the interests and safety of your child/ward in cyberspace.
